analyzed: phyis sngom pa'i bsam pa med pa rnams la ni ma yin te /

original: 'di ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig dug gis zin na sman pa 'gas de bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu 'ga' zhig dug gis zin na sman pa 'gas de bzlog pa'i phyir /

original: sman gyi btung ba blud nas yang sngar bzhin dug za ba dang mtshungs so //
analyzed: sman gyi btung ba blud nas yang sngar bzhin dug za ba dang mtshungs so //

original: slar yang rjes gnang thob nas tshogs kyi thu bo'i ming ni gzhon par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: slar yang rjes gnang thob nas tshogs kyi thu bo'i ming ni gzhon par 'gyur ba yin //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

original: rgan rabs gang zhig rtsa ba'i ltung bar gyur pa slar dkyil 'khor du bcug pa de slar zhing dkyil 'khor du thu ber 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rgan rabs gang zhig rtsa ba'i ltung bar gyur pa slar dkyil 'khor du bcug pa de slar zhing dkyil 'khor du thu ber 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i nges pa'o //
translated: This is the ascertainment of the TathƒÅgata.

original: da ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnams brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba rnams brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to state the root downfalls,

translated: [the BhagavƒÅn] declares, ‚Äúagitated mind of the glorious guru,‚Äù and so forth.

analyzed: 'dir rgyud thams cad du rtsa ba'i ltung ba ni bcu bzhir nges pa yin la /

analyzed: de rnams so so ji lta ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: bu rnams rtsa ba'i ltung ba ri bod 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúThe sons who hold the root downfalls‚Äù and so forth.

original: spyir ba tang ba yin te /
analyzed: spyir ba tang ba yin te /

original: bcu bzhi po rgyud las gsungs pa ltar ma bskyangs na /
analyzed: bcu bzhi po rgyud las gsungs pa ltar ma bskyangs na /
translated: If one does not protect the fourteen as they are taught in the tantras,

original: shing ta la'i mgo bcad nas slar skye ba'i skal ba med de /
analyzed: shing ta la'i mgo bcad nas slar skye ba'i skal ba med de /
translated: one will be like a palm tree whose head has been cut off, lacking the fortune to grow again.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba ltar rdo rje 'chang chang gi gnas las ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ba ltar rdo rje 'chang chang gi gnas las ltung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means that one will fall from the state of Vajradhara.

original: de yang dpal ldan bla ma'i sems dkrugs zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yang dpal ldan bla ma'i sems dkrugs zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúagitated mind of the glorious guru‚Äù and so forth.

original: bla ma yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bla ma yang rnam pa gnyis te /

original: dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dam pa dang / dam pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: de la dam pa ni sems can thams cad kyi don gyi phyir sems 'khrugs pa'o //

analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa ni bdag gi bsnyen bkur gyi phyir sems dkrugs pa yin la / de'i phyir bla ma'i sems dkrugs pa ni mi dge ba bcu la sogs pa byed cing bla ma gang de'i mi dge ba'i rnam grangs byed pa ni rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur gyi rang gi don ltung len cing bdag nyid kyang mi dge ba bcu la 'jug pa'i
translated: The ignoble is the disturbance of mind for the sake of one's own honor.üîΩ Therefore, the disturbance of the guru's mind is a root downfall if one commits the ten nonvirtues, etc., and the guru is one's own benefactor.

original: bla ma la ni yin par nges pa'o //üîΩde yang bla ma dam pa yin par shes pa dang / de mi dgyes par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pas kun nas @50a * //üîΩbslangs pa'i lus ngag gi las dang / gzhan gyi don ma yin pa dang / rang gi don ltung blang ba'i bsam pa dang / slar sbyang ba'i bsam pa med pa ste /
analyzed: bla ma la ni yin par nges pa'o // de yang bla ma dam pa yin par shes pa dang / de mi dgyes par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pas kun nas @50a * // bslangs pa'i lus ngag gi las dang / gzhan gyi don ma yin pa dang / rang gi don ltung blang ba'i bsam pa dang / slar sbyang ba'i bsam pa med pa ste /
translated: It is certain that it is a downfall if one commits the ten nonvirtues, etc., and the guru is not one's own benefactor.

original: chos drug gis ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos drug gis ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, it is a downfall due to six factors: knowing that the guru is a noble person, knowing that the guru is displeased, physical or verbal action motivated by affliction, not being for the sake of another, the intention to take one's own defeat as defeat, and the absence of the intention to later confess.

original: de'i bka' 'gongs zhes pa ni bla ma de'i zhes pa dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i bka' 'gongs zhes pa ni bla ma de'i zhes pa dang sbyar ro //

analyzed: bka' 'gongs pa ni bla ma dam pas bsgo ba mi nyan pa'o //

original: de yang chos drug dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: de yang chos drug dang ldan pas so //

original: gzhan du 'gyur zhes pa ni gnyis par 'gyur pa'o //üîΩsbun la khros pa yang ni gsum par nges //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur zhes pa ni gnyis par 'gyur pa'o // sbun la khros pa yang ni gsum par nges //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: spun ni bla ma gcig gis yongs su bsdus pa yin la /

analyzed: gzhan gyi spun la khro bo ni khan mtho ba chung bar gsungs so //

original: de yis bsgo zhing bstan pa la gus par mi 'dzin cing khro na gsum pa ste /
analyzed: de yis bsgo zhing bstan pa la gus par mi 'dzin cing khro na gsum pa ste /
translated: If one is angry at one's guru and does not respect his advice and teachings, it is a third,

original: rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: which is a root downfall.

original: de yang gong gi chos drug las rang rang gi rdo rje spun gyis khyad par du byas pa dang / chos bdun dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gong gi chos drug las rang rang gi rdo rje spun gyis khyad par du byas pa dang / chos bdun dang ldan pa'o //

original: byams pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byams pa spong ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase abandoning love means

analyzed: 'dir byams pa spong ba la chos bzhi ste /

original: tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi rab bo //
analyzed: tha ma dang / 'bring dang / rab dang / rab kyi rab bo //
translated: the least, the middling, the great, and the greatest.

original: de la tha ma ni chur dbyug pas ri mo bris pa ltar /
analyzed: de la tha ma ni chur dbyug pas ri mo bris pa ltar /

analyzed: skad cig gcig tsam byams pa dang bral yang slar 'jug pa'o //

analyzed: 'bring ni bye ma la ri mo bris ba rlung gis 'phral la nyams par 'gyur ba ltar /

analyzed: dus de ma thag tu byams par 'jug pa'o //
translated: It returns again immediately.üîΩThe great is like a crack in the earth that is lost by a stream of water.

original: rab ni dper na sa'i ser ka can gyi char gyi rgyun gyis nyams par byed pa ltar byams ba cung zad na dran pa'o //
analyzed: rab ni dper na sa'i ser ka can gyi char gyi rgyun gyis nyams par byed pa ltar byams ba cung zad na dran pa'o //
translated: It is lost by a little love.üîΩThe greatest is like a rock, etc., that have cracks, etc., and never again have the fortune to be even.

original: rab kyi rab ni dper na brag la sogs pa ma khregs pa'i bdag nyid can rnams la gas pa la sogs pa byung na nam du yang mnyam par 'gyur ba'i skal ba med pa ltar ram shing thog smin cing sa la ltung ba rnams phyir zhing shing rnams
analyzed: rab kyi rab ni dper na brag la sogs pa ma khregs pa'i bdag nyid can rnams la gas pa la sogs pa byung na nam du yang mnyam par 'gyur ba'i skal ba med pa ltar ram shing thog smin cing sa la ltung ba rnams phyir zhing shing rnams
translated: Or it is like a ripe fruit that falls to the ground and never again has the fortune to stick to the tree.

original: la 'byar ba'i skal ba med cing mi gnas pa ltar /
analyzed: la 'byar ba'i skal ba med cing mi gnas pa ltar /

analyzed: byams pa ltar spangs pa'i rtsa ba'i ltung bar 'gyur te / chu tshod drug cu'i bar gyis so //

original: rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi par 'gyur ba ni nges pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba'i ltung ba bzhi par 'gyur ba ni nges pa'o //

original: byang chub kyi sems spangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi sems spangs pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúGiving up the thought of awakening‚Äù means

analyzed: 'dir byang chub kyi sems kyi sa bon yi la gang yang de nyams na bde ba rmi 'gyur te ; de bas na de nyid ma thob cing dbang po gnyis kyi bde bas sangs gyas par 'dod pa rnams la rtsa ba'i ltung ba mda' zhes bya ba lnga par de yang shes rab chen pos mi 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin zhes pa dang / 'gyur ba'i bde ba tsam du blang ba'i bsam pa dang /
translated: that if the seed of the thought of awakening is damaged, one will have bad dreams.üîΩTherefore, for those who have not attained that and who desire to be satisfied by the bliss of the two organs, it is a fifth root downfall.

original: de la legs par 'dzin pa dang / gsang ba dang / gzhan gyi bde @50b ba'i don dang / ri lu la sogs pa'i ched ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de la legs par 'dzin pa dang / gsang ba dang / gzhan gyi bde @50b ba'i don dang / ri lu la sogs pa'i ched ma yin pa ste /
translated: That is also the case for one who has the intention of taking only the bliss of change, who is not a person of great wisdom, who is not a person of the nature of immutability, who is not a person who holds that well, who is not a person who keeps it secret, who is not a person who acts for the welfare of others, and who is not a person who is not interested in pills and so forth.

original: chos bzhi dang ldan nas mda' zhes bya ba lnga par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos bzhi dang ldan nas mda' zhes bya ba lnga par 'gyur ro //
translated: One becomes a ‚Äúfive-arrow‚Äù by possessing four dharmas.üîΩ‚Äú

original: grub mtha' la smod ces pa ni /
analyzed: grub mtha' la smod ces pa ni /
translated: One who disparages the conclusion‚Äù

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa yin la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa yin la /
translated: is one who is in the Perfection Vehicle.

original: de dang gsang sngags kyi tshul tha dad par 'dzin pa ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba yin zhing /
analyzed: de dang gsang sngags kyi tshul tha dad par 'dzin pa ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba yin zhing /
translated: Holding that it is different from the way of Mantra is a root downfall.

original: de las gzhan pa'i theg pa la smad bas ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i theg pa la smad bas ni rtsa ba'i ltung ba ma yin no //
translated: Disparaging other vehicles is not a root downfall.

original: des kyang thun mong gi dngos grub las 'phrog pa yin no //üîΩdes kyang gsang sngags kyi theg pa dang / dbyer med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la zhe sdang la gnas pas smra ba dang / gzhan gyi don la ma yin pa dang / legs par 'dzin pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: des kyang thun mong gi dngos grub las 'phrog pa yin no // des kyang gsang sngags kyi theg pa dang / dbyer med pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i theg pa la zhe sdang la gnas pas smra ba dang / gzhan gyi don la ma yin pa dang / legs par 'dzin pa dang / 'gyod pa med pa ste /
translated: That also steals the common accomplishments.

original: chos lnga dang ldan pas drug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos lnga dang ldan pas drug par 'gyur ro //
translated: That also is a six-arrow by possessing five dharmas:üîΩone who is angry at the vehicle of the perfection of wisdom, which is inseparable from the vehicle of Mantra, and speaks of it as different,üîΩnot for the benefit of others,üîΩand who holds it well and is without regret.

original: ma smin sems can la ni gsang ba ster //
analyzed: ma smin sems can la ni gsang ba ster //
translated: ‚ÄúOne who gives the secret to unripened sentient beings‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: is as follows.

original: ma smin pa ni nyon mongs kyi lam gyis mnan pa'i gang zag yin la /
analyzed: ma smin pa ni nyon mongs kyi lam gyis mnan pa'i gang zag yin la /
translated: The unripened are persons who are oppressed by the path of afflictions.

original: de gang la gsang sngags kyi gsang ba bsgrags na skrag cing smod pa la brjod pas ltung ba yin te /
analyzed: de gang la gsang sngags kyi gsang ba bsgrags na skrag cing smod pa la brjod pas ltung ba yin te /
translated: If the secret of the secret mantra is proclaimed to them, it is a downfall to speak of it to those who are frightened and disparaging.

original: gzhan mos par 'gyur ba dang / dad pa dang grol ba'i skal ba yod pa la nyes pa med par gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan mos par 'gyur ba dang / dad pa dang grol ba'i skal ba yod pa la nyes pa med par gsungs so //
translated: It is said that there is no fault if one speaks to those who have faith and the fortune of being liberated.

original: de yang gsang ba sgrugs nas mos pa ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i gang zag dang / gdul ba'i don nam yin pa dang / bde ba chen po'i gsang ba bstan pa ste /
analyzed: de yang gsang ba sgrugs nas mos pa ma yin pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i gang zag dang / gdul ba'i don nam yin pa dang / bde ba chen po'i gsang ba bstan pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is a downfall if one proclaims the secret to a person who will not have faith, if it is not for the purpose of guiding someone, or if one teaches the secret of great bliss.

original: chos gsum dang ldan ni ri zhes bdun par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gsum dang ldan ni ri zhes bdun par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has three qualities, it is a downfall.üîΩThe downfall of teaching the secret of great bliss other than that causes the loss of mundane powers.

original: bde ba chen po'i gsang ba las gzhan pa bstan pa'i ltung bas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub nyams par byed do / lus nyon mongs pa klu ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bde ba chen po'i gsang ba las gzhan pa bstan pa'i ltung bas 'jig rten pa'i dngos grub nyams par byed do / lus nyon mongs pa klu ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The body is the nƒÅgas of affliction.

original: lus te phung po lnga la sogs pa ni rgyal pa rigs lnga'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: lus te phung po lnga la sogs pa ni rgyal pa rigs lnga'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The body, the five aggregates, and so on, are the nature of the five royal families.

original: khams dang skye mched ni lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched ni lha mo dang byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The elements and sense-fields are the goddesses and the Bodhisattvas.

original: nyon mongs par byed ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nyon mongs par byed ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The afflictions are of two kinds:

original: lus la tsha grang dang bza' ba ltung gis nyon mongs par byed pa dang / gsod pa'i brtson pas nyon mongs par bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: lus la tsha grang dang bza' ba ltung gis nyon mongs par byed pa dang / gsod pa'i brtson pas nyon mongs par bskyed pa'o //
translated: those that afflict the body, such as heat, cold, and hunger, and those that afflict the mind, such as anger and desire.

original: de ci'i phyir rtsa ba'i ltung ba yin snyam pa la /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir rtsa ba'i ltung ba yin snyam pa la /
translated: Why are these root downfalls?

original: phung po gzir bas bde ba mi skye la /
analyzed: phung po gzir bas bde ba mi skye la /
translated: Because the body is afflicted, happiness does not arise.

original: bde ba ma skyes pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bde ba ma skyes pas gnyis su med pa'i ye shes la nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: And because happiness does not arise, one falls from the nondual knowledge.

original: gsod pa la brtson pa ni sems bskyed pas ltung bar 'gyur ba gsungs la /
analyzed: gsod pa la brtson pa ni sems bskyed pas ltung bar 'gyur ba gsungs la /
translated: As for the effort to kill, it is said that one falls by generating the thought of killing.

original: de bas de'i phyir rtsa ba'i ltung ba ste /
analyzed: de bas de'i phyir rtsa ba'i ltung ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is a root downfall.

original: de yang phung po la sogs pa rgyal ba dang / lha mo dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yin par shes pa dang de mnar bas bde ba las nyams par shes pa dang / gzhang dul ba'i don du ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang phung po la sogs pa rgyal ba dang / lha mo dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yin par shes pa dang de mnar bas bde ba las nyams par shes pa dang / gzhang dul ba'i don du ma yin pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is because one knows that the aggregates and so forth are the Victorious One, the goddesses, and the Bodhisattvas, and because one knows that by afflicting them one falls from happiness, and because it is not for the sake of subduing the mind.

original: chos gsum @51a * //
analyzed: chos gsum @51a * //
translated: These are the three dharmas.

original: dang ldan na ltung ba brgyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang ldan na ltung ba brgyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has it, there is the eighth downfall.

original: dag pa'i chos la ma dad pa'ang //
analyzed: dag pa'i chos la ma dad pa'ang //
translated: Also, lack of faith in the pure Dharma.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This isüîΩthe ninth root downfall.

original: dag pa'i chos ni 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par spang ba'i stong ba nyid zab mo gang yin pa de /
analyzed: dag pa'i chos ni 'dzin pa thams cad rnam par spang ba'i stong ba nyid zab mo gang yin pa de /
translated: The pure Dharma is the profound emptiness that is the complete abandonment of all grasping.

original: de lam dad cing sun 'byin pa rtsa ba'i ltung ba ste /
analyzed: de lam dad cing sun 'byin pa rtsa ba'i ltung ba ste /
translated: Lack of faith in it and denigration of it is a root downfall.

original: de yang gdul ba'i don ma yin pa dang / stong pa nyid gang yin ba de spangs te spros pa dang bcas pa la dang du blang ba'i chos gnyis kyis ltung ba dgu par 'gyur ro //
